text: In photometry, luminous intensity is a measure of the wavelength-weighted power emitted by a light source in a particular direction per solid angle unit, based on the luminosity function, a standardized model of the sensitivity of the human eye. The SI unit of luminous intensity is the candela (cd), an SI base unit. Category:Astronomy Category:Light Category:Optics Category:Physical quantity Category:Physics Category:Physiology
title: Luminous intensity
